docs.title: System Health AI – Desktop Client
docs.text: An AI-powered system health monitoring application built using PyQt5 that collects real-time system metrics, generates diagnostic reports, and synchronizes them with a cloud backend for AI-driven analysis.

docs.title: Key Capabilities
docs.text:
• Real-time system monitoring using psutil
  • Secure Google OAuth authentication
  • Automated health report generation
  • Cloud synchronization via Supabase
  • AI chatbot with RAG-based OS-specific knowledge
  • Cross-platform support (Windows, Ubuntu, Arch Linux)

docs.title: Who is this for?
docs.text:
• Developers diagnosing system performance issues
  • Students building AI + systems projects
  • Power users who want intelligent system insights

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text: The AI chatbot helps users: - Understand performance issues - Interpret reports - Get OS-specific optimization advice

docs.title: RAG Strategy
docs.text:
• Base LLM handles reasoning
  • OS-specific documents injected as context
  • Separate knowledge bases for:
  • Windows
  • Ubuntu
  • Arch Linux

docs.title: Example Queries
docs.text:
• "Why is my CPU usage high on Windows?"
  • "How do I optimize swap usage on Ubuntu?"

docs.title: High-Level Flow
docs.text:
1. User authenticates via Google OAuth in the desktop app
  2. System metrics are collected using psutil
  3. A structured health report is generated locally
  4. Report is uploaded securely to Supabase
  5. User logs into the web dashboard to view reports
  6. AI chatbot uses RAG to answer system-related questions

docs.title: Desktop Client (PyQt5)
docs.text:
• UI and user interaction
  • OAuth authentication
  • Local data collection
  • Report generation

docs.title: AI Layer
docs.text:
• LLM-based chatbot
  • RAG context per operating system
  • Diagnostic reasoning on system metrics

docs.title: System Monitoring
docs.text: The desktop client collects real-time system metrics using psutil.

docs.title: Metrics Collected
docs.text:
• CPU usage (percentage & core-wise)
  • RAM usage
  • Disk usage and I/O
  • System uptime
  • Process snapshot
